A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: While I was entertained and at the end of the day it is a Star Wars movie I'm feeling a bit disappointed and frustrated by the Last Jedi. This seems to be a classic case of an insecure director trying too hard to be original and flex their movie muscles. The Force Awakens honored the past and ushered in the new. Last Jedi simply throws tradition away in a way that simply doesn't fit in the Star Wars world. That's why I had such a hard time with this film. Without giving away any spoilers I just didn't believe that some of the major actions made by key characters were actually what THEY would have done and/or wanted. Instead we got Rian Johnson force choking each character into actions they probably wouldn't choose for themselves. Curious to see if it grows on me but at the moment I'm very underwhelmed.
